1.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Wasteland: Destroy target nonbasic land.
1.texto: "I will show you fear in a handful of dust." - T. S. Eliot, "The Waste Land"

2.descricao:
{U}{U}, Sacrifice a Wizard: Counter target spell.

Morph {U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

3.descricao:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fuse counter on Powder Keg.

{T}, Sacrifice Powder Keg: Destroy each artifact and creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of fuse counters on Powder Keg.
legalidade: Official Reprint Policy (This card is on the reserved list)

regras.texto: Only destroys artifacts and creatures with exactly the specified cost. It does not mean "less than or equal to".
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

4.descricao:
Discard a card: Psychatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Exile two cards from your graveyard: Psychatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

5.descricao: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

6.descricao:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.

Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

regras.texto: The additional cost is paid when you pay the rest of Fireball's costs, even though that text appears second on the card (to make the card easier to read). The additional cost doesn't count toward Fireball's converted mana cost.

If, for example, X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R}). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal at that time.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

7.descricao: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated.

8.descricao: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

9.descricao: Exile target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.

10.descricao:
Flying

Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
10.texto:
"There was no trace
Of aught on that illumined face..." -Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Phantom"

regras.texto: The ability triggers even if the Specter's damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

11.descricao: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put that card on the top or bottom of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

12.descricao: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.

13.descricao: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

14.descricao: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.

regras.texto: This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an artifact, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

15.descricao: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

16.descricao: Lightning Helix deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.

regras.texto: If the creature or player is an illegal target as Lightning Helix tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

17.descricao: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

18.descricao: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.

regras.texto: The affected creature's last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its toughness.
This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an enchantment, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

20.descricao: Psionic Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player and 2 damage to you.

regras.texto: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

23.descricao: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

24.descricao: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

regras.texto: This is the timeshifted version of Wrath of God.

26.descricao: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.

regras.texto: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won't do anything. The creature can't be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

27.descricao: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

regras.texto: The payment is optional.
This is the timeshifted version of Force Spike.
This is the timeshifted version of Concentrate.

29.descricao:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.

Draw a card.

regras.texto: If you choose to shuffle your library, that includes the three cards you just looked at and put back on top of it.

30.descricao: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

regras.texto: The swamps are counted on resolution.
The life you gain is equal to the damage dealt by Corrupt, not necessarily to the number of Swamps you control (if some or all of the damage is prevented, for example).

The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player's life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you'll gain 6 life.
Corrupt counts any land you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

31.descricao: Choose two — Counter target spell; or return target permanent to its owner's hand; or tap all creatures your opponents control; or draw a card.

regras.texto: You choose both modes as you cast Cryptic Command. You must choose two different modes.

Look at both chosen modes to determine how many targets Cryptic Command has, if any. If it has at least one target, and all its targets are illegal when it tries to resolve, then it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. For example, if you choose the second and fourth modes, and the permanent is an illegal target when Cryptic Command tries to resolve, you won't draw a card.

32.descricao:
({2/R} can be paid with any two mana or with {R}. This card's converted mana cost is 6.)

Flame Javelin deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

regras.texto: If an effect reduces the cost to cast a spell by an amount of generic mana, it applies to a monocolored hybrid spell only if you've chosen a method of paying for it that includes generic mana.

A card with a monocolored hybrid mana symbol in its mana cost is each of the colors that appears in its mana cost, regardless of what mana was spent to cast it. Thus, Flame Javelin is red even if you spend six green mana to cast it.

A card with monocolored hybrid mana symbols in its mana cost has a converted mana cost equal to the highest possible cost it could be cast for. Its converted mana cost never changes. Thus, Flame Javelin has a converted mana cost of 6, even if you spend {R}{R}{R} to cast it.

If a cost includes more than one monocolored hybrid mana symbol, you can choose a different way to pay for each symbol. For example, you can pay for Flame Javelin by spending {R}{R}{R}, {2}{R}{R}, {4}{R}, or {6}.

34.descricao:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)

Target creature gets +3/-3 and loses all creature types until end of turn.

regras.texto: If a creature loses all creature types but then gains a new creature type later in the turn, it will be that new creature type.
Examples of creature types include Sliver, Goblin, and Soldier. Creature types appear after the dash on the type line of creatures.
A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

36.descricao: Blightning deals 3 damage to target player. That player discards two cards.

regras.texto: The targeted player will discard two cards even if some or all of Blightning's damage is prevented or redirected.

37.descricao: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

regras.texto: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

39.descricao: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

40.descricao: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

42.descricao: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

43.descricao: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

44.descricao:
Volcanic Fallout can't be countered.

Volcanic Fallout deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

regras.texto: Volcanic Fallout can be targeted by spells that try to counter it (such as Countersquall). Those spells will still resolve, but the part of their effect that would counter Volcanic Fallout won't do anything. Any other effects those spells have will work as normal.

45.descricao: Exile target black or red permanent.

regras.texto: Lands are colorless (even if their frames have some colored elements to them). You can't target a Swamp, a Mountain, or any other land with Celestial Purge (unless some other effect has turned that land black or red).

46.descricao:
Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom in a random order.)

Bituminous Blast deals 4 damage to target creature.

regras.texto: Cascade triggers when you cast the spell, meaning that it resolves before that spell. If you end up casting the exiled card, it will go on the stack above the spell with Cascade.
When the Cascade ability resolves, you must exile cards. The only optional part of the ability is whether or not your cast the last card exiled.
If a spell with Cascade is countered, the Cascade ability will still resolve normally.
You exile the cards face-up. All players will be able to see them.

If you exile a split card with Cascade, check if at least one half of that split card has a converted mana cost that's less than the converted mana cost of the spell with cascade. If so, you can cast either half of that split card.

If you cast the last exiled card, you're casting it as a spell. It can be countered. If that card has cascade, the new spell's cascade ability will trigger, and you'll repeat the process for the new spell.

After you're done exiling cards and casting the last one if you chose to do so, the remaining exiled cards are randomly placed on the bottom of your library. Neither you nor any other player is allowed to know the order of those cards.

47.descricao:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)

Burst Lightning deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If Burst Lightning was kicked, it deals 4 damage to that creature or player instead.

48.descricao:
As an additional cost to cast Harrow, sacrifice a land.

Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

regras.texto: The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can't pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect.
The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

50.descricao: Choose a color. White creatures you control gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn. (They can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything of that color.)
50.texto: "Trust me, your lost fingers and toes are nothing compared to the lost treasures of Sejiri."—Zahr Gada, Halimar expedition leader

regras.texto: You choose a color as Brave the Elements resolves. Once the color is chosen, it's too late for players to respond.

Only white creatures you control at the time Brave the Elements resolves gain the protection ability. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn, or that turn white later in the turn, won't have it.

51.texto: The void is without substance but cuts like steel.

52.descricao: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card, then put all cards revealed this way into your hand.
52.texto: "The longer the journey, the more one learns."—Isanke, Halimar seastalker

regras.texto: The cards you put into your hand this way include one nonland card, plus all the land cards on top of it in your library (if any). If the top card of your library is a nonland card, you just get that one.
If all the cards left in your library are lands, you'll reveal all of them and put them all into your hand.

53.descricao:
Searing Blaze deals 1 damage to target player and 1 damage to target creature that player controls.

Landfall — If you had a land enter the battlefield under your control this turn, Searing Blaze deals 3 damage to that player and 3 damage to that creature instead.

regras.texto: You must choose two targets as you cast Searing Blaze
If either target is illegal by the time Searing Blaze resolves, it still deals damage to the other target.
